abstract: The gravity areas available in a stack view.
overview:
## Overview

The layout of a stack view is partitioned into three distinct areas in which you can place views. These are known as *gravity areas*. You can use these constants to configure a stack view by way of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/insertView(_:at:in:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/setViews(_:in:)] methods.

In a horizontally oriented stack view, the three gravity areas are [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/leading], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/center], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/trailing]. The ordering of these areas depends on the user interface language, unless you’ve explicitly specified the stack view’s user interface layout direction by calling the inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] method. For a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] property value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSUserInterfaceLayoutDirection/leftToRight], the leading gravity area is on the left.

In a vertically oriented stack view, the three gravity areas are always [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/top], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/center], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/bottom].

The center gravity area is constrained to remain geometrically centered with an Auto Layout priority of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Priority-swift.struct/defaultLow]. For information about geometric spacing between gravity areas, see the description of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/spacing] property.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/appkit/nsstackview/gravity
crawled: 2025-12-04T18:58:03Z

# NSStackView.Gravity

**Enumeration**

The gravity areas available in a stack view.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Gravity
```

## Overview

The layout of a stack view is partitioned into three distinct areas in which you can place views. These are known as *gravity areas*. You can use these constants to configure a stack view by way of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/insertView(_:at:in:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/setViews(_:in:)] methods.

In a horizontally oriented stack view, the three gravity areas are [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/leading], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/center], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/trailing]. The ordering of these areas depends on the user interface language, unless you’ve explicitly specified the stack view’s user interface layout direction by calling the inherited [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] method. For a [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSView/userInterfaceLayoutDirection] property value of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSUserInterfaceLayoutDirection/leftToRight], the leading gravity area is on the left.

In a vertically oriented stack view, the three gravity areas are always [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/top], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/center], and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/Gravity/bottom].

The center gravity area is constrained to remain geometrically centered with an Auto Layout priority of [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSLayoutConstraint/Priority-swift.struct/defaultLow]. For information about geometric spacing between gravity areas, see the description of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStackView/spacing] property.

## Constants

- **NSStackView.Gravity.top**: The topmost gravity area in a vertically oriented stack view.
- **leading**: The leftmost or rightmost gravity area in a horizontally oriented stack view, based on the user interface language or the explicitly set user interface layout direction.
- **NSStackView.Gravity.center**: The center gravity area, regardless of stack view layout direction or user interface language.
- **NSStackView.Gravity.bottom**: The bottommost gravity area in a vertically oriented stack view.
- **trailing**: The leftmost or rightmost gravity area in a horizontally oriented stack view, based on the user interface language or the explicitly set user interface layout direction.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Managing Views in Gravity Areas

- **addView(_:in:)**: Adds a view to the end of the stack view gravity area.
- **insertView(_:at:in:)**: Adds a view to a stack view gravity area at a specified index position.
- **setViews(_:in:)**: Specifies an array of views for a specified gravity area in the stack view, replacing any previous views in that area.
- **removeView(_:)**: Removes a specified view from the stack view.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
